__TOC__

 See also: <nowiki>[[Grantbow-SFSUWorkshops]]</nowiki>      

    Information Management Systems Association (<nowiki>[[http://imsa.sfsu.edu|IMSA]]</nowiki>) of San Francisco State University in conjunction with <nowiki>[[GrantBowman]]</nowiki> are currently working on a series of workshops that will provide students majoring in <nowiki>[[http://is.sfsu.edu|Information Systems]]</nowiki> with an opportunity to discover Open Source systems. Additionally, students will have a real hands on experience administrating, setting up, and supporting these systems. We will be asking speakers from the community to come present. 

Possible workshop topics:

* workshop 1 - Sat, Feb 27th
** OS installation (partitions, installation techniques, file systems, and etc) ; creating a private network; basic work with terminal; DHCP and DNS 
* workshop 2 - Sat, Mar 13th
** TCP/IP, basic routing, DHCP, DNS, and setting up email server
* workshop 3 - Sat, Mar 20th or 27th
** monitoring network, creating wifi gateways, printer servers, and other services
* workshop 4 - Sat, Apr 10th or 17th
** creating LAMP environment (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP)
* workshop 5 - Sat, May 1st
** backups and periodic processes
* workshop 6 - TBD
** virtualization and security
* workshop 7 - TBD
** shell scripting boot camp
* workshop 8 - TBD
** system performance analysis

Please be aware that all topics and dates are not final
